==Ethics as a Measure of Religiosity (in Sociology of Religion)==
  +
According to the sociologist [[Mervin F. Verbit|Mervin Verbit]], ethics may be understood as one of the key components of religiosity. And religious ethics itself may be broken down into four dimensions:
  +
*[[content]]
  +
*[[frequency]]
  +
*[[intensity]]
  +
*[[centrality]]
  +
The content of a religious ethic may vary from one religion to the next, as will the degree to which it may may be applicable (frequency), the intensity of the ethic, and the centrality of the ethic (in that religious tradition).<ref>Verbit, M. F. (1970). The components and dimensions of religious behavior: Toward a reconceptualization of religiosity. American mosaic, 24, 39.</ref><ref>Küçükcan, T. (2010). Multidimensional Approach to Religion: a way of looking at religious phenomena. Journal for the Study of Religions and Ideologies, 4(10), 60-70.</ref><ref>http://www.eskieserler.com/dosyalar/mpdf%20(1135).pdf</ref>
